results.title: Captain James Cook
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy, Shell Film Unit and Geoffrey Collings
results.brief_description: Retraces the voyages of Captain Cook along the east coast of Australia from Mallacoota Inlet to Cape York, and contrasts Cook’s comments with the developments that have since taken place. Gabo island, Botany Bay, Brisgane, Bustard Bay and Rockhampton, Magnetic Island, Cape Tribulation, the Endeavour River and the present Cooktown. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Captain James Cook
results.creator_credit: Michael Latham, John irvin and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
During the years 1768-1770 Captain James Cook sailed around the world in the ‘Endeavour’ and claimed Australia for the British Crown. This is an account of his voyage. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Captain Huff and Harry: problem solving - consumer mathematics
results.creator_credit: Aesop Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: To fix her broken ship Captain Huff must buy new rivets and a rudder. At the store she uses a calculator to make unit price comparisons, a 10% discount, sales tax and delivery charges. An animated film. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.title_for_label: Captain Huff and Harry: problem solving - consumer mathematics

results.title: Captain Horatio Hornblower
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Raoul Walsh and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: C.S. Forester’s Napoleonic era naval hero, Captain Horatio Hornblower is made larger than life by an excellent performance from Gregory Peck. This is an epic film with plenty of broadside action and cannon fire as Hornblower’s man-o-war takes on the French and Caribbean pirateers. Hornblower’s sterness is eventually softened by true love in the guise of Lady Barbara Wellesley (Wellington’s sister), played by Virginia Mayo. This is an exciting, action-filled film with an eye for accurate historical detail.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Warner Bros Pictures, Raoul Walsh and Ken Adam

results.title: Captain Feathersword the friendly pirate
results.creator_credit: Paul Field, Wiggles Touring Pty Ltd and Chisholm McTavish
results.brief_description: Come and dance and have lots of fun with Captain Feathersword and his friend The Wiggles, Wags the Dog, Dorothy the Dinosaur, Henry the Octopus, Officer Beaples and his pirate shipmates. Take a trip down memory lane with the Captain as he tries to teach old Wags the Dog some new tricks (and Wags teaches the Captain some magic), dances with his nephew, Captain No-beard, and follow the Wiggles as they help the Captain learn to count to ten!
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Field, Wiggles Touring Pty Ltd and Chisholm McTavish

results.title: Captain Cook safari
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson, Cine Service and General Motors Holden
results.brief_description: General Motors Holden’s trial drivers and a Brisbane T.V. team travel from Brisbane to Cooktown in four new production model vehicles, to commemorate the bi-centenary of Captain Cook’s 100 days on the Queensland coast. They visit the points where Captain Cook’s expedition landed in 1770. Shows the different terrain and driving conditions in route. Narrated by Geoff Raymond and photographed by Ken Jacoby.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Thompson, Cine Service and General Motors Holden

results.title: Captain Blood
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Cosmopolitan and Michael Curtiz
results.brief_description: Peter Blood, a young doctor unjustly condemned for treating rebels is sentenced to slavery. Arabella, the beautiful niece of a cruel plantation owner, buys him, but Blood and his mates eventually escape and begin a career of piracy, gallantly fighting off adversaries on the high seas. After a strange twist of fate, Arabella and Blood meet again and justice and romance prevail. This film, with its thrilling sea battles launched the careers of Errol Flynn and Olivia de Havilland in the title roles.

results.title: Captain and kings
results.creator_credit: Ron Lowe and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Top end”.
The film examines why Greek immigrants settled in Darwin and their contribution to its development both socially and economically. Interviews with Greek small-businessmen and their wives are conducted about their businesses, family life and how they see themselves in both the Greek and Australian communities. Interviews with non-Greek Darwin residents are also conducted.

results.title: Caps for sale [B&W]
results.brief_description: This is a charming tale about a peddler whose stolen caps mean all kinds of monkey business. Whimsical illustrations and flighty trills of music reflect the storyteller’s words. Based on the book written and illustrated by Esphyr Slobodkina. Narrated by Esphyr Slobodkina.
